case.name: Huang v University of New South Wales [2008] FCA 1930 (18 December 2008)

citphrases.citphrase: sex, race and disability discrimination in education
allegations of harassment by phd supervisors
allegations of discrimination on the basis of inadequate english language ability and mental disabilities
appeal from decision of federal magistrate summarily dismissing application
whether case so clear as to justify summary dismissal discrimination law
whether his honour erred in his determination that the alleged acts against the appellant by the first respondent could not amount to sexual harassment
vicarious liability of second respondent for conduct of first respondent not considered by court below
interpretation of s 28a sex discrimination act 1984 (cth)
anti discrimination list vcat reference no. a316/2005 anti-discrimination list
whether conduct complained capable of constituting conduct of a sexual nature.
sex, race and disability discrimination in education
interlocutory ruling that the court has no jurisdiction to consider a complaint of victimisation that has not been terminated by hreoc.
nature of the concept of sexual harassment
decision by the human rights and equal opportunity commission upholding complaints of sexual harassment but refusing any award of damages
whether decision of commission attended with any error of law
in relation to conduct at pre-employment interviews, relevance of facts that complainants were subsequently offered employment and that complainants refused to answer some questions
in relation to subsequent conduct, whether, upon the basis of the commission's findings, the applicants were entitled to damages
relevance of public exposure of respondent's conduct
power of federal court to determine any claim for damages without further reference to commission.
